member.name: T:GraphQL.ValueConverter
member.summary:
This class provides value conversions between objects of different types. Conversions are registered in a static thread safe dictionary and are used for all schemas in the application.
Each ScalarGraphType calls ConvertTo method to return correct value type from its ParseValue method. Also conversions may be useful in advanced GetArgument use cases when deserialization from the values dictionary to the complex input argument is required.

member.name: M:GraphQL.ValueConverter.#cctor
member.summary: Register built-in conversions. This list is expected to grow over time.

summary.para: Returns an object of the specified type and whose value is equivalent to the specified object.
Throws a if there is no conversion registered; conversion functions may throw other exceptions
Returns an object of the specified type and whose value is equivalent to the specified object.
Throws a if there is no conversion registered; conversion functions may throw other exceptions
If a conversion delegate was registered, converts an object to the specified type and returns true; returns false if no conversion delegate is registered.
Conversion delegates may throw exceptions if the conversion was unsuccessful

member.name: M:GraphQL.ValueConverter.Register(System.Type,System.Type,System.Func{System.Object,System.Object})
member.summary:
Allows you to register your own conversion delegate from one type to another.
If the conversion from valueType to targetType is already registered, then it will be overwritten.
member.param: Type of original value.
Converted value type.
Conversion delegate; null for unregister already registered conversion.

member.summary:

member.param: Conversion delegate; null for unregister already registered conversion.

member.summary:
Allows you to register your own conversion delegate from dictionary to some complex object.
This method may be useful in advanced GetArgument use cases when deserialization from the values dictionary to the complex input argument is required.

member.typeparam: Converted value type.
member.param: Conversion delegate; null for unregister already registered conversion.

member.summary:
Examines @skip and @include directives for a node and returns a value indicating if the node should be included or not.
Note: Neither @skip nor @include has precedence over the other. In the case that both the @skip and @include directives are provided on the same field or fragment, it must be queried only if the @skip condition is and the @include condition is . Stated conversely, the field or fragment must not be queried if either the @skip condition is or the @include condition is .

member.summary:
Before execution, the selection set is converted to a grouped field set by calling CollectFields(). Each entry in the grouped field set is a list of fields that share a response key (the alias if defined, otherwise the field name). This ensures all fields with the same response key included via referenced fragments are executed at the same time.
and

member.name: T:GraphQL.IDocumentExecuter
member.summary:
Processes an entire GraphQL request, given an input GraphQL request string. This is intended to be called by user code to process a query.
Typical implementation starts metrics if enabled (see Metrics), relies on IDocumentBuilder to parse the query, IDocumentValidator to validate it, and IComplexityAnalyzer to validate the complexity constraints. Then it executes document listeners if attached, selects an execution strategy, and executes the query via IExecutionStrategy. Unhandled exceptions are handled as appropriate for the selected options.

member.name: F:GraphQL.GlobalSwitches.NameValidation
member.summary:
Gets or sets current validation delegate. By default this delegate validates all names according to the GraphQL specification.
Setting this delegate allows you to use names not conforming to the specification, for example 'enum-member'. Only change it when absolutely necessary. This is typically only overridden when implementing a custom that fixes names, making them spec-compliant.
Keep in mind that regardless of this setting, names are validated upon schema initialization, after being processed by the . This is due to the fact that the parser cannot parse incoming queries with invalid characters in the names, so the resulting member would become unusable.

member.name: P:GraphQL.GlobalSwitches.UseDeclaringTypeNames
member.summary: Specifies whether to use the names of parent (declaring) types in case of nested graph types when calculating default graph type name.

member.name: T:GraphQL.Introspection.__DirectiveArgument
member.summary:
The __DirectiveArgument introspection type represents an argument of a directive applied to a schema element - type, field, argument, etc.
Note that this class describes only explicitly specified arguments. If the argument in the directive definition has default value and this argument was not specified when applying the directive to schema element, then such an argument with default value will not be returned.

summary.para: A field resolver returns an object for a given field within a graph.
The property defines the field resolver to be used for the field.

Typically an instance of FuncFieldResolver or AsyncFieldResolver is created when code needs to execute within the field resolver - typically by calling FieldBuilder.Resolve or FieldBuilder.ResolveAsync.
When mapping fields to source object properties via Field(x => x.Name), ExpressionFieldResolver is used.
When a field resolver is not defined, such as with Field("Name"), the static instance of is used.

member.name: M:GraphQL.Resolvers.NameFieldResolver.CreateDelegate(System.Type,System.String)

summary.para: Dynamically creates the necessary delegate in runtime to get the property/method value of the specified type.

So resulting Func will be generated as {x => Convert(Convert(x, Person).Age, Object)}
1. First, the input parameter 'x' is converted from the object to a specific type.
2. The required property or method is extracted from casted value.
3. Then result is converted again to the object and returned from the method.

member.param: The type from which you want to get the value.
Property/method name.
member.returns: Compiled delegate to get the value.

member.name: T:GraphQL.ExperimentalIntrospectionFeaturesMode
member.summary: A way to use experimental features.

member.name: F:GraphQL.ExperimentalIntrospectionFeaturesMode.ExecutionOnly
member.summary: Allow experimental features only for client queries but not for standard introspection request. This means that the client, in response to a standard introspection request, receives a standard response without any new fields and types. However, client CAN make requests to the server using the new fields and types. This mode is needed in order to bypass the problem of tools such as GraphQL Playground, Voyager, GraphiQL that require a standard response to an introspection request and refuse to work correctly if there are any unknown fields or types in the response.

member.name: F:GraphQL.ExperimentalIntrospectionFeaturesMode.IntrospectionAndExecution
member.summary: Allow experimental features for both standard introspection query and client queries. This means that the client, in response to a standard introspection request, receives a response augmented with the new fields and types. Client can make requests to the server using the new fields and types.

Overriding this method allows for customizing the deserialization process of input objects, much like a field resolver does for output objects. For example, you can set some 'computed' properties for your input object which were not passed in the GraphQL request.

member.name: M:GraphQL.Types.InputObjectGraphType`1.ToAST(System.Object)
member.summary:
Converts a value to an AST representation. This is necessary for introspection queries to return the default value for fields of this input object type. This method may throw an exception or return for a failed conversion.
The default implementation always throws an exception. It is recommended that this method be overridden to support introspection of fields of this type that have default values. This method is not otherwise needed to be implemented.

member.name: T:GraphQL.Types.LengthDirective
member.summary:
Used to specify the minimum and/or maximum length for an input field or argument.
When applied to argument or input field, this directive itself does not check anything. It only declares the necessary requirements and these requirements will be visible in introspection if ExperimentalFeatures.AppliedDirectives feature is enabled on schema. Use validation rule if you want to enable checking for the length of arguments and input fields.

The schema for the GraphQL request. Contains references to the 'query', 'mutation', and 'subscription' base graph types.
Also allows for adding custom directives, additional graph types, and custom value converters.
only requires the Query property to be set; although commonly the Mutation and/or Subscription properties are also set.

This method should be safe to be called from multiple threads simultaneously.

member.name: P:GraphQL.Types.ISchema.FieldMiddleware
member.summary: Note that field middlewares from this property apply only to an uninitialized schema. If the schema is initialized then adding additional middleware through the builder does nothing. member.name: M:GraphQL.Types.ScalarGraphType.Serialize(System.Object)
member.summary:
Result (output) coercion. It takes the result of a resolver and converts it into an appropriate value for the output result. In other words it transforms a scalar from its server-side representation to a representation suitable for the client.
Since GraphQL specifies no response format, Serialize is not responsible for preparing the scalar for transport to the client. It is only responsible for generating an object which can eventually be serialized by some transport-focused API.
This method should handle a value of , but may throw an exception if is an invalid internal scalar representation.
member.param: Resolved value (internal scalar representation). May be .
member.returns: The returned value of a the result coercion is part of the overall execution result. Normally this value is a primitive value like String or Integer to make it easy for the serialization layer. For complex types like a Date or Money scalar this involves formatting the value. Returning is valid.

member.name: M:GraphQL.Types.ScalarGraphType.ParseLiteral(GraphQL.Language.AST.IValue)
member.summary:
Literal input coercion. It takes an abstract syntax tree (AST) element from a schema definition or query and converts it into an appropriate internal value. In other words it transforms a scalar from its client-side representation as an argument to its server-side representation. Input coercion may not only return primitive values like String but rather complex ones when appropriate.
This method must handle a value of .
member.param: AST value node. Must not be , but may be .
member.returns: Internal scalar representation. Returning is valid.

member.name: M:GraphQL.Types.ScalarGraphType.ParseValue(System.Object)
member.summary:
Value input coercion. Argument values can not only provided via GraphQL syntax inside a query, but also via variable. It transforms a scalar from its client-side representation as a variable to its server-side representation.
Parsing for arguments and variables are handled separately because while arguments must always be expressed in GraphQL query syntax, variable format is transport-specific (usually JSON).
This method must handle a value of .
member.param: Runtime object from variables. May be .
member.returns: Internal scalar representation. Returning is valid.

member.name: M:GraphQL.Types.ScalarGraphType.CanParseLiteral(GraphQL.Language.AST.IValue)
member.summary:
Checks for literal input coercion possibility. It takes an abstract syntax tree (AST) element from a schema definition or query and checks if it can be converted into an appropriate internal value. In other words it checks if a scalar can be converted from its client-side representation as an argument to its server-side representation.
This method can be overridden to validate input values without directly getting those values, i.e. without boxing.
This method must return when passed a node.
member.param: AST value node. Must not be , but may be .

member.name: M:GraphQL.Types.ScalarGraphType.CanParseValue(System.Object)
member.summary:
Checks for value input coercion possibility. Argument values can not only provided via GraphQL syntax inside a query, but also via variable. It checks if a scalar can be converted from its client-side representation as a variable to its server-side representation.
Parsing for arguments and variables are handled separately because while arguments must always be expressed in GraphQL query syntax, variable format is transport-specific (usually JSON).
This method can be overridden to validate input values without directly getting those values, i.e. without boxing.
This method must return when passed a value.
member.param: Runtime object from variables. May be .

member.summary: Checks that the provided value is a valid default value. This method should not throw an exception.
member.param: The value to examine. Must not be , as that indicates the lack of a default value.

member.name: M:GraphQL.Types.ScalarGraphType.ToAST(System.Object)
member.summary: Converts a value to an AST representation. This is necessary for introspection queries to return the default values of this scalar type when used on input fields or field and directive arguments. This method may throw an exception or return for a failed conversion. May return .
member.param: The value to convert. May be .
member.returns: AST representation of the specified value. Returning indicates a failed conversion. Returning is valid.

member.summary: Throws an exception indicating that a value cannot be converted to its AST representation. Typically called by if the provided object (an internal representation) is not valid for this scalar type.

member.name: M:GraphQL.Types.ScalarGraphType.ThrowLiteralConversionError(GraphQL.Language.AST.IValue)
member.summary: Throws an exception indicating that an AST scalar node cannot be converted to a value. Typically called by if the node type is invalid or cannot be parsed.

member.name: M:GraphQL.Types.ScalarGraphType.ThrowValueConversionError(System.Object)
member.summary: Throws an exception indicating that an external value (typically provided through a variable) cannot be converted to an internal representation. Typically called by if the provided object is invalid or cannot be parsed.
member.remarks: This is often called for serialization errors, since calls by default. This also may be called for serialization errors during , since calls by default, which by default calls .

member.name: M:GraphQL.Types.ScalarGraphType.ThrowSerializationError(System.Object)
member.summary: Throws an exception indicating that an internal value (typically returned from a field resolver) cannot be converted to its external representation. Typically called by if the object is not valid for this scalar type.
member.remarks: This may be called for serialization errors during , since the default implementation of calls to serialize the value before converting the result to an AST node.

member.name: M:GraphQL.Types.Schema.System#IServiceProvider#GetService(System.Type)
member.summary:
Gets the service object of the specified type. Schema itself acts as a service provider used to create objects, such as graph types, requested by the schema.
Note that most objects are created during schema initialization, which then have the same lifetime as the schema's lifetime.
Other types created by the service provider may include directive visitors, middlewares, validation rules, and name converters, among others.
Explicit implementation of the method makes this method less visible to the calling code, which reduces the likelihood of using it as so called ServiceLocator anti-pattern. However, in some advanced scenarios this may be necessary.
member.param: An object that specifies the type of service object to get.
member.returns: A service object of type or null if there is no service object of type serviceType.

member.name: T:GraphQL.Validation.Rules.InputFieldsAndArgumentsOfCorrectLength
member.summary:
Validation rule that checks minimum and maximum length of provided values for input fields and arguments that marked with directive. Doesn't check default values.
This is not a standard validation rule that is not in the official specification. Note that this rule will be required to run on cached queries also since it works with request variables, so ExecutionOptions.CachedDocumentValidationRules needs to be set as well (if using caching).

member.name: F:GraphQL.Validation.Rules.InputFieldsAndArgumentsOfCorrectLength.Instance
member.summary: Returns a static instance of this validation rule.

member.name: T:GraphQL.Validation.Rules.KnownDirectivesInAllowedLocations
member.summary:
Known directives:
GraphQL servers define what directives they support and where they support them. For each usage of a directive, the directive must be available on that server and must be used in a location that the server has declared support for.

member.name: F:GraphQL.Validation.Rules.KnownDirectivesInAllowedLocations.Instance
member.summary: Returns a static instance of this validation rule.

member.name: T:GraphQL.Validation.Rules.UniqueDirectivesPerLocation
member.summary:
Unique directive names per location:
A GraphQL document is only valid if all not repeatable directives at a given location are uniquely named.

member.name: F:GraphQL.Validation.Rules.UniqueDirectivesPerLocation.Instance
member.summary: Returns a static instance of this validation rule.

member.name: T:GraphQL.Validation.Rules.UniqueVariableNames
member.summary:
Unique variable names:
A GraphQL operation is only valid if all its variables are uniquely named.

member.name: F:GraphQL.Validation.Rules.UniqueVariableNames.Instance
member.summary: Returns a static instance of this validation rule.

member.name: T:GraphQL.Validation.Rules.VariablesAreInputTypes
member.summary:
Variables are input types:
A GraphQL operation is only valid if all the variables it defines are of input types (scalar, enum, or input object).

member.name: F:GraphQL.Validation.Rules.VariablesAreInputTypes.Instance
member.summary: Returns a static instance of this validation rule.

member.name: T:GraphQL.Validation.Rules.NoUndefinedVariables
member.summary:
No undefined variables:
A GraphQL operation is only valid if all variables encountered, both directly and via fragment spreads, are defined by that operation.

member.name: F:GraphQL.Validation.Rules.NoUndefinedVariables.Instance
member.summary: Returns a static instance of this validation rule.

member.name: T:GraphQL.Validation.Rules.NoUnusedVariables
member.summary:
No unused variables:
A GraphQL operation is only valid if all variables defined by that operation are used in that operation or a fragment transitively included by that operation.

member.name: F:GraphQL.Validation.Rules.NoUnusedVariables.Instance
member.summary: Returns a static instance of this validation rule.

member.name: T:GraphQL.Validation.Rules.VariablesInAllowedPosition
member.summary: Variables passed to field arguments conform to type.

member.name: F:GraphQL.Validation.Rules.VariablesInAllowedPosition.Instance
member.summary: Returns a static instance of this validation rule.

member.name: T:GraphQL.Validation.Rules.ArgumentsOfCorrectType
member.summary:
Argument values of correct type:
A GraphQL document is only valid if all field argument literal values are of the type expected by their position.

member.name: F:GraphQL.Validation.Rules.ArgumentsOfCorrectType.Instance
member.summary: Returns a static instance of this validation rule.

member.name: T:GraphQL.Validation.Rules.DefaultValuesOfCorrectType
member.summary:
Variable default values of correct type:
A GraphQL document is only valid if all variable default values are of the type expected by their definition.

member.name: F:GraphQL.Validation.Rules.DefaultValuesOfCorrectType.Instance
member.summary: Returns a static instance of this validation rule.

member.name: T:GraphQL.Validation.Rules.FieldsOnCorrectType
member.summary:
Fields on correct type:
A GraphQL document is only valid if all fields selected are defined by the parent type, or are an allowed meta field such as __typename.

member.name: F:GraphQL.Validation.Rules.FieldsOnCorrectType.Instance
member.summary: Returns a static instance of this validation rule.

member.name: M:GraphQL.Validation.Rules.FieldsOnCorrectType.GetSuggestedTypeNames(GraphQL.Types.IGraphType,System.String)
member.summary: Go through all of the implementations of type, as well as the interfaces that they implement. If any of those types include the provided field, suggest them, sorted by how often the type is referenced, starting with Interfaces.

member.name: M:GraphQL.Validation.Rules.FieldsOnCorrectType.GetSuggestedFieldNames(GraphQL.Types.IGraphType,System.String)
member.summary: For the field name provided, determine if there are any similar field names that may be the result of a typo.

member.name: T:GraphQL.Validation.Rules.FragmentsOnCompositeTypes
member.summary:
Fragments on composite type:
Fragments use a type condition to determine if they apply, since fragments can only be spread into a composite type (object, interface, or union), the type condition must also be a composite type.

member.name: F:GraphQL.Validation.Rules.FragmentsOnCompositeTypes.Instance
member.summary: Returns a static instance of this validation rule.

member.name: T:GraphQL.Validation.Rules.KnownArgumentNames
member.summary:
Known argument names:
A GraphQL field is only valid if all supplied arguments are defined by that field.

member.name: F:GraphQL.Validation.Rules.KnownArgumentNames.Instance
member.summary: Returns a static instance of this validation rule.

member.name: T:GraphQL.Validation.Rules.KnownFragmentNames
member.summary:
Known fragment names:
A GraphQL document is only valid if all ...Fragment fragment spreads refer to fragments defined in the same document.

member.name: F:GraphQL.Validation.Rules.KnownFragmentNames.Instance
member.summary: Returns a static instance of this validation rule.

member.name: T:GraphQL.Validation.Rules.KnownTypeNames
member.summary:
Known type names:
A GraphQL document is only valid if referenced types (specifically variable definitions and fragment conditions) are defined by the type schema.

member.name: F:GraphQL.Validation.Rules.KnownTypeNames.Instance
member.summary: Returns a static instance of this validation rule.

member.name: T:GraphQL.Validation.Rules.LoneAnonymousOperation
member.summary:
Lone anonymous operation:
A GraphQL document is only valid if when it contains an anonymous operation (the query short-hand) that it contains only that one operation definition.

member.name: F:GraphQL.Validation.Rules.LoneAnonymousOperation.Instance
member.summary: Returns a static instance of this validation rule.

member.name: T:GraphQL.Validation.Rules.NoFragmentCycles
member.summary:
No fragment cycles:
A GraphQL document is only valid if it does not contain fragment cycles.

member.name: F:GraphQL.Validation.Rules.NoFragmentCycles.Instance
member.summary: Returns a static instance of this validation rule.

member.name: T:GraphQL.Validation.Rules.NoUnusedFragments
member.summary:
No unused fragments:
A GraphQL document is only valid if all fragment definitions are spread within operations, or spread within other fragments spread within operations.

member.name: F:GraphQL.Validation.Rules.NoUnusedFragments.Instance
member.summary: Returns a static instance of this validation rule.

member.name: T:GraphQL.Validation.Rules.OverlappingFieldsCanBeMerged
member.summary:
Overlapping fields are mergable:
If multiple field selections with the same response names are encountered during execution, the field and arguments to execute and the resulting value should be unambiguous. Therefore any two field selections which might both be encountered for the same object are only valid if they are equivalent.
Due to the complexity of the implementation, this validation rule is not part of the default set of validation rules.

member.summary: Returns a static instance of this validation rule.

member.name: T:GraphQL.Validation.Rules.PossibleFragmentSpreads
member.summary:
Possible fragment spread:
A fragment spread is only valid if the type condition could ever possibly be : if there is a non-empty intersection of the possible parent types, and possible types which pass the type condition.

member.name: F:GraphQL.Validation.Rules.PossibleFragmentSpreads.Instance
member.summary: Returns a static instance of this validation rule.

member.name: T:GraphQL.Validation.Rules.ProvidedNonNullArguments
member.summary:
Provided required arguments:
A field or directive is only valid if all required (non-null) field arguments have been provided.

member.name: F:GraphQL.Validation.Rules.ProvidedNonNullArguments.Instance
member.summary: Returns a static instance of this validation rule.

member.name: T:GraphQL.Validation.Rules.ScalarLeafs
member.summary:
Scalar leafs:
A GraphQL document is valid only if all leaf fields (fields without sub selections) are of scalar or enum types.

member.summary: Returns a static instance of this validation rule.

member.summary: Subscription operations must have exactly one root field.

member.name: T:GraphQL.Validation.Rules.UniqueArgumentNames
member.summary:
Unique argument names:
A GraphQL field or directive is only valid if all supplied arguments at a given field are uniquely named.

member.name: T:GraphQL.Validation.Rules.UniqueFragmentNames
member.summary:
Unique fragment names:
A GraphQL document is only valid if all defined fragments have unique names.

member.name: T:GraphQL.Validation.Rules.UniqueInputFieldNames
